title: 2011년 Lee v. State 사건
summary: 미국 Alabama, AL 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Lee v. State. 판결일: 2011-02-04. 법원: Court of Criminal Appeals of Alabama.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: Samuel Lashaun LEE v. STATE of Alabama
**판결일**: 2011-02-04
**법원**: Court of Criminal Appeals of Alabama
**관할**: Alabama, AL

**판사**: Kellum, Welch, Windom

## 변호인

Samuel Lashaun Lee, pro se., Troy King and Luther Strange, attys. gen., and Laura I. Cuthbert, asst. atty. gen., for appellee.

## 인용

- 74 So. 3d 101

## 판결문 요약


74 So.3d 101 (2011)
Samuel Lashaun LEE
v.
STATE of Alabama.
CR-09-1751.
Court of Criminal Appeals of Alabama.
February 4, 2011.
Rehearing Denied March 11, 2011.
Certiorari Denied June 10, 2011 Alabama Supreme Court 1100711.
Samuel Lashaun Lee, pro se.
Troy King and Luther Strange, attys. gen., and Laura I. Cuthbert, asst. atty. gen., for appellee.
*102 WELCH, Judge.
Samuel Lashaun Lee appeals from the circuit court's summary denial of his petition seeking resentencing pursuant to § 15-22-54.1, Ala.Code 1975.
On July 2, 2010, Lee filed a petition for resentencing pursuant to § 15-22-54.1, Ala.Code 1975. In his petition, Lee asserted that he had been convicted of first-degree robbery and sentenced to 15 years' imprisonment. The trial court suspended the sentence and placed Lee on five years' probation. Lee stated that his probation was revoked on November 10, 2004. The record does not disclose the reason for the revocation. Lee attached to his petition documents reflecting that he had completed various programs while he was incarcerated. On July 12, 2010, without requiring further information or a response from the State, the circuit court summarily denied Lee's petition on the basis that Lee's underlying conviction was for a violent offense.[1] This appeal followed.
On appeal, Lee argues that the circuit court erred when it determined that he was ineligible for resentencing under § 15-22-54.1 because he is a violent offender. Lee argues that the reasoning of Holt v. State, 96...
